author: TisnKu
body:
### Summary of the new feature / enhancement

From time to time, I get the message when I open terminal. I would need to open github release page, find the matched version and install an MSI. The process is super inconvenient.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10512841/169763022-0f8ee7c9-663b-479d-93a0-d6fda6e783a0.png)

Really appreciate it if I can install/update the package within terminal directly. Maybe we can add a command in the update message to inform user how to update PSCore within terminal.

### Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

_No response_

comments.author: jhoneill
comments.body:
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/tools/install-powershell.ps1 will do the job. _edit_ ``` iex "& { $(irm https://aka.ms/install-powershell.ps1) } -UseMSI" ``` _Downloads and runs that script using the MSI for the install._ I think there's a case to include it with the PowerShell installation. Probably time to page @doctordns because I know this is something he's been taking an interest in, and there multiple variations on the "this message isn't helpful" theme.

comments.author: dwtaber
comments.body:
> ```
> iex "& { $(irm https://aka.ms/install-powershell.ps1) } -UseMSI" 
> ```

It would be convenient to have this as a built-in function.  Or for more flexibility, maybe this:
```powershell
 iex "& { $(irm https://aka.ms/install-powershell.ps1) } $args"
```

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: Beside the `install-powershell.ps1`, you can also enable Windows Update when installing the MSI package, and then pwsh will be automatically updated within 2 weeks of a new release.

comments.author: TisnKu
doctordns
comments.body:
yes - I have long been a fan of doing rather better than just saying "there's an update'''". 

IF the team wanted to ship ``install-powershell.ps1`` as part of the installation, that would solve my problem (well, that and updating the message to say "run install-powershell to install newest version".

Should I raise another issue to get this idea debated and discussed?

comments.author: jhoneill
doctordns
comments.body:
Indeed - I have added some comments. I am not sure we need a NEW command - the install-powershell.ps1 script handles all the key scenarios. Admittedly no support for installation from the store - but that is probably not relevant as there is no app store on Server.

My personal preference is an `Install-PowerShell.,ps1` shipped inside BOTH WIndows PowerShell and PowerShell 7. Those updated versions should also have an updated message to run this new command. That woudl handle both the "I just have 5 and want 7" and the "I have 7, but need an update faster than Windows Update can provide" scenairos.

comments.author: jhoneill
comments.body: @doctordns  best if the substantive comments are on the RFC, but I agree - if the existing script went into PS7, and a future windows update dropped it into PS5 (and possibly older OSes with PS4)  that would do >90% of what's needed.
